title: Who did X Factor: Celebrity's Jeremy Edwards play in Hollyoaks?
text:
Jeremy Edwards will be seen singing as part of a duo (Photo by Jason LaVeris/FilmMagic)

Actor Jeremy Cole is due to appear on The X Factor: Celebrity in just a few short hours.

On the subject of criticism he and his singing partner Brendan Cole received, Jeremy has said: ‘This was just me, I can’t speak for Brendan on this… Brendan is more used to it than I am. They edited down quite a lot of what Howie said and I’m gonna be completely honest with you, I don’t think a lot of it was necessary.

‘That’s all because I don’t mind criticism, and certain things didn’t work but certain things did and there was a lot of positives there, but A, he talked for ages and B, it was negative, negative, negative.’

As we wait to tune in and see for ourselves what we think of the performances, here’s a look back at Jeremy’s career from Hollyoaks and beyond…

Who did Jeremy Edwards play in Hollyoaks?

Soap fans with a long enough memory will remember Jeremy from when he played Kurt Benson in Hollyoaks.

He first appeared on the soap in 1995, and was a recurring character until 1998.

He reprised his role as Kurt in 2013 for Hollyoaks Later.

His character Kirk was one of the soaps original characters.

Bad-boy Kirk was close with Tony Hutchinson (Nick Pickard) had a firey relationship with Ruth Osborne (Terri Dwyer).

Kirk ended up getting violent with Kate Patrick (Natasha Symms), with whom he’d previously had an affair, and that frightened his then-wife Ruth.

He ended up leaving Hollyoaks after he and Ruth decided to call it quits.

It was later revealed that he was killed off-screen in a jet ski accident.

When he appeared on Hollyoaks Later, it was as a figment of Tony’s imagination.

Since his time on Hollyoaks, Jeremy played Danny Shaughnessy on Holby City from 1999 until 2003.

He also appeared on an episode of Emmerdale in 2008 and in two episodes of Doctors in 2018.

From 2014 until 2018, he had a recurring role as Mike on Millie Inbetween.
